scenes.background: [Monica] taps her fingers on the table. You suggested tweaking the approach to be more flexible.
scenes.description: Bob leans forward, narrowing his eyes. 'Tweaking won't solve the foundational issues. We need a solid plan.'

options.text: Foundational issues take time to address. Let's start with small changes and build from there.
options.analysis: You suggest a gradual approach, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation, but your motivation to make immediate changes is lower.

options.text: You’re right. Perhaps we need to re-evaluate our entire strategy from the ground up.
options.analysis: You agree with the need for a solid plan and suggest re-evaluating the strategy, showing high empathy and social skill but lower self-regulation.

options.text: If we keep changing plans, we'll never make progress. Let’s commit to one strategy and see it through.
options.analysis: You advocate for sticking to one plan, demonstrating high motivation and social skill, but your emotional perception and empathy are lower.
